38791760.review:
Really good game.

As some might already come to expect the "driving force" of this game, is the gameplay side of it, the narrative its fine, but frankly it won't make that much sense unless you have played the first game, which I have, but not for a very, very, very long time...

Even then, the gameplay is enough for me personally to recommend this game.

It is fantastic, it's fast, violent, just incredibly brutal in every way, there's ways that you can execute your enemies that end up dismembering them, or simply turning them into amorph combinations of meat, and bones.

The whole things plays out like some sort of "arcadey" hack'n slash video game, you have to characters to play the game with, both with different narratives, from what i've seen, both of them use different weapons, but most of them are "melee" at that you can get katanas, chainsaws, or even, as it was in my case, a massive, freaking, needle.

The problem with this weapons is that for the most part I found the "switching" system between them to be slow, and sluggish, the game tries to create a flow through the fight by allowing you to combine different weapons, to create interesting, and prolongued "combos" that end up tearing your enemies apart, but I never really found an incentive to use them other than to see if they felt any different from the ones I already have, which I was pleased with, turns out most of them, even while fully upgrading them, end up being worse weapons than the ones you already have from the start.

It wasn't until I got the minigun which allowed me to SHOOT enemies, plus, its subsequent upgrade, a shotgun blast that you can trigger in the middle of a "barrage" of attacks, when I understood that the weapons you got where supposed to be used in the middle of the combat as an addition to your base weapons, instead of the ones being your main ones.

But at that point I had already developed strategies, and familiarity with the default loadout, even while imposing to myself the experimentation between the weapons I had in relation to new ones, wasn't enough for me to find them even satisfying, let alone useful in any way.

That however, didn't detracted from the joy of the incredibly fast-paced, and violent combat system, shared with the interesting and straightfoward level design that held plenty of secrets that I could find.

Such as "beads" that all have their own unique, different design, plus advantages that can grant you things like increased damage against certain enemies, or getting a more frequent drop of a certain item.

It works really well, and I found those collectibles as well as the different "guitar solos" that you can find to be fun, and useful minigames that ended up making the game a bit more diverse.

This "guitar solos" play like a musical game would, you pretty much hear the music, look at some flashing, colored lights, and follow the incoming button prompts, you have to be accurate in order to get a 100% of each song, which would then give you more "money".

That then you can use to upgrade your equipment, such as your weapons, and, or health, whilst also allowing you to purchase items that you can use in the middle of a fight, I personally didn't find that much use to them, but I was playing at easier difficulties, so there...

I guess that's also one thing I must mention about this game, I remember the first "Dishwasher" game that I played years ago was very difficult, so much so that the developers of this game listened to player, and critics, feedback, and ended up making different difficulties for different people, so the game retains a much more "casual" appeal than the first one, while still promoting much more "hardcore" players play on higher difficulties, by even unlocking an even harder difficulty than the one available from the start, after you finish the game in any.

So overall, I totally recommend this game, its great fun, its brutal, and violent, there's always a bunch of blood and limbs flying all over the place, I like the aesthetic even if at times in can be both depressing, and "messy" but I find it distinctive, and unique, particular of this games, and the developers who created them, it has been almost an "staple" for a lot of its other "projects".

They totally chopped my arm off! 

D:

The Dishwasher, Vampire Smile is the most metal game I’ve ever played. 

Hack, slash, bash, and smash your way through a horde of cyber zombies and mishmash robot creatures on the moon. Splatter gooey red cyborg blood jam all over the place as you rev your chainsaw arm or wield a giant, spike covered hammer. Fight as either Yuki, a vampire out for revenge on those who framed her for the destruction of Earth, or the Dishwasher, the iconic undead samurai from the first game of the same name. 

Or grab a friend and play as both in a brother/sister duo of ultimate destruction in the co-op mode. 

Open presents, rock out on guitar/violin solos, and fight ridiculous bosses. Enjoy the hand drawn cutscenes, the game’s visceral sense of style, and its signature dark humor. 

Gameplay is fast and vicious. Harder difficulties will cause you pain, but I enjoyed everything so much I threw myself back into the combat repeatedly again and again.

Remember, dodging is life. Standing still is death. Your most effective attacks on your enemies are from behind. 

You have been warned. 

My only real complaint is that they haven’t ported the first game over to steam yet, but this game stands pretty good on its own.

36299431.review:
This is an unambigiously wonderful game.

It's probably the best thing I've played this year, and that's a time period that includes Salt & Sanctuary.

There's another Dishwasher game that comes before this, but it's not on steam and you don't need to play it to appreciate Vampire Smile. Honestly, part of why I love this might be that I went in totally blind and everything the game threw at me was a totally welcome surprise. 

I went in expecting a platformer, and instead got a highly technical frantic 2D character action game built around combat flow. All of your moves, even your heavies, come out lightning-fast. Everything strings together. Everything can be canceled into with a dash. The dash (at least on the route I played) is a teleport with i-frames and a slowdown effect when you dodge through a significant enemy attack, giving you a quarter second to assess where you are in the battle and where you need to be. 

But wait. There's more.

Land a long enough string of hits on an enemy, and you can instakill them with a grab. Nearly all of combat is a teleporting, air-dashing, combo-stringing, grab-killing waltz of blood and viscera, but there are guns (mainly for pushback and breathing room) and spells to help clear particularly thick waves of enemies.

Despite being on rails, the game has some light metroidvania elements and slightly heavier RPG elements. Like a DMC title, you can upgrade health, magic, individual weapons, etc with currency from murdered enemies. Unlike a DMC title, you get your full selection of moves very early on, but there's no unlocking new combos. Mastery comes from knowing what to switch to and when, and also from controlling combat flow. I'm not good at these types of games, but I felt like a god every time I got into a flow-state with this.

And really, that would be enough to recommend this to anyone who likes the character action genre, but wait.

There's more.

Vampire Smile has the kind of story, implicit world-building, and enemy design that a soulslike would be proud of.

The atmosphere, sound design, and visual effects in Vampire Smile are all deeply moody like in other Ska games, but it isn't bleak like Salt & Sanctuary. It isn't irreverent like Charlie Murder, either. Vampire Smile has an utterly gonzo, but equally serious story to tell. You don't need the prequel game as context (and again, I suggest going in blind, starting with the Prisoner's route), as things are revealed to you when you need to know them. To give you a taste, there are cyborgs, robots, undead, government agents, and reality demons, it's all set on the moon, magic is real, everything of importance is settled with katanna duels, and your goal is to assassinate capitalism.

On top of that, Vampire Smile isn't afraid to switch genre and gameplay elements on the fly, spontaneously turning into Silent Hill, Guitar Hero, and at one memorable point an Atari title. Its boss designs are visually and mechanically pleasing, which is to say they're white-knuckled controller-gripping affairs (don't play this with mouse and keyboard. I'm not even sure if you can) that all contribute something to the lore.

If I have a single gripe about this game, it's that the first twenty minute pick up a little slow, but that's scraping the bottom of the critique-barrel. 

I would love to see another title in this series, but until one is announced, this thing is a steal at $10.

36250613.review:
Now before I start talking about this game, this is a sequel to the game The Dishwasher dead samurai. I have not played it yet so I won’t talk about if this game is better than the first one. Now to this game.

The Dishwasher: Vampire Smile is one of the most fun games I have ever played; there is a lot to talk about this game, so let’s start with the story.

You can play up to two characters. Yuki or her step brother a guy called the dishwasher. Now first Yuki’s story, 

you play as Yuki a young girl pinned for the crime of destroying the world. She is sent to the spaceship prison Iffenhaus, but during a nightmare, she has she wakes up to the image of her slaughtering a prison guard and discovers she has this, newfound powers.

So she decides to escape and pursue a quest for revenge, against the three figures of power known as The Banker, General and Judge. Who put her there.

Okay now for Yuki’s step brother.

you play as the undead warrior called the dishwasher. After the first game The Dishwasher and a guy called Chef destroyed the world after it became uninhabitable, because of the evil Sinthesis AI - The Master Computer and the Fallen Engineer and there’re evil Cyborg army.

But even with the world destroyed the dishwasher sees that a new evil Cyborg army is taking power; on the last home for humans the moon. So it’s up to him to hunt down and destroy this new evil Cyborg army and they corrupt leaders.

Now what I loved about this game, is that it’s very fair but still hard, what I mean about that is the enemy’s don’t feel cheap. If you die it’s your own fault, but with time you can win. 

Speaking about the enemies. I loved the enemies and bosses especially the bosses, they have unique looks and some are very scary looking. 

My fav bosses are Goreface, the lich, skeletank, and the scourge. The only boss I wish they did more with was the invalid, but other than that all the other bosses are all good and fucked up.

Combat was good, especially with the different weapons in the game. From swords and guns, to more unique ones like a giant needle, and the squirt gun with an electric toaster. So you can come up with your own way of killing enemies. I liked the art style. Music was good too.

Now the only well, not bad but still could have made the game better. There was no pause dialogue, what I mean is, well in game’s cutscenes they are done like a comic book but it goes so fast you can’t read what’s on them all.

Now with that, the game is still kickass. Hard but fair game play, scary and unique bosses, and a scary Cyberpunk feeling. So I say get this awesome, awesome game.

35229889.review:
This game is a hell of a good time! The combat is fluid and fun, it can be picked up immediately without a tutorial, and once you get through the first two or three levels, the difficulty really kicks in. Mechanics are a blast and the art style is unique adds greatly to the experience.

I must also note just how wonderfully helpful and responsive the developers are.  Yesterday I was having a slight problem with my saves (which turned out to be entirely my fault, not a bug). I posted the problem I was having on the discussion board asking for help in general, and within an hour or two one of the developers personally responded to my comments. Through several exchanges, he walked me through possible causes of the issue and solutions, and even had me email him my save file so he could inspect it. It was really a pleasure getting extensive help from such an engaged developer, and really bodes well for the future of this game and all their others (like Salt and Sanctuary, which is just amazing!).

So, hats off to the developers for making such a great game. I can't wait to see what they do next.

35229559.review:
When I saw this come onto Steam, I became excited. I remembered playing this with my brother when I was a kid after buying it from the XBLA. However, I was hesitant to buy it, afraid that my love for it would be torn after not looking at it through the nostalgic glasses. I bit the bullet and decided to get it. I'm happy to say that it more than holds up to me.

Gameplay:
This game... is amazing. Even though it looks like a metroidvania, it is not. It has elements such as getting keys and backtracking, however it is divided into levels. The hacking and slashing feels fluent and always feels like I'm in control. It's frantic hack n' slash at it's best with an amazing soundtrack. That being said, the game is hard. However, it doesn't take the easy way out with manufactured difficulty by throwing too much at you. The combat is genuinely challenging and requires you to change your weapons on the fly. There are a couple mechanics that are not fully realized, such as the dodge/shift ability. I always felt that you should be able to stun them if you phase through them. These mechanics would mean nothing if the game was poorly ported. However, that is not the case. I did not encounter a single crash and while there are no graphical settings apart from monitor selection, resolution, full-screen/windowed/borderless-windowed mode select, and v-sync toggle (happy to say the with it on, I did not see any input lag), the game is not graphically demanding at all and should run fine on most rigs. The only downside I see is the frame-rate locked at 60fps, even with vsync off. It didn't affect me since I have a 60hz monitor, but I know some people care about their unlocked framerates. 

The game is short, me beating one of the stories in a little under 4.5 hours. That beign said, it is a game that offers more than one playthrough. You have challenges, the arcade, and playing the other side of the story. Oh yeah, and do yourself a favor and use a controller. You're welcome.

Graphics:
Originally being an XBLA title, you shouldn't expect breathtaking visuals. However, the art style in itself is breathtaking. It does have that flash game comic feel to the graphics on the surface, however it's stylized and polished in such a way that it doesn't feel like it could have been released on newgrounds in 2009. The dark and grungy color pallet suits the massive amounts of red that you'll be spraying all over the enviornments. I do not have the original version on hand, however I'll have to assume that they made the textures sharper. I don't remember if the XBLA version was 60fps either.

The story:
I won't be spoiling anything here, just my thoughts on the basic premise of the story. It's a story. It's not the center point, as the action is. There are two characters to play as, each has their own story. Well, kind of. They do have their own weapons and kind of their own story, but it follows the basic outline. It kind of feels like a reskin when playing as a different character.

The verdict:
I love this game. It holds up extremely well and I'm extremely happy to get it. It is well optomized, has an amazing soundtrack that compliments the dark and grusome atmosphere amazingly. At $10, it's a great value.

35050845.review:
The Dishwasher games were my introduction into the world of Ska Studios and to this day remains my favorite 2D platformer. James and Michelle Silve (Developers) are two of my heroes due to their unique vision. The style of this game seems to fly in the face of conventional game development while paying homage to the sidescrolling adventure games of the past. The combat feels raw and visceral while the handdrawn style of the Silvas is awe inspiring and certainly not to be slept on. For the price, I would be hard pressed to find a better deal anywhere on Steam. This is the first review I've ever written for a Steam game and I'm so happy that I get to spend it singing the praises of this amazing game! Do yourself a favor and play The Dishwasher: Vampire Smile NOW! (You can thank me later)

                                                           -Gummywormjim

33813092.review:
Ska Studios c первой игры (которой для меня была Salt and Sanctuary) попала в список моих любимых инди разработчиков.
Их игры выполнены в узнаваемом стиле, с отличными саунтреками, явными и не очень отсылками к другим произвидениям игропрома, шикарным геймплеем, минииграми, сюжетом и вообще всем, чего можно пожелать от игры.
Diswashers - это моя третья игра от данной студии и покупая ее [spoiler] а покупал я все игры отдельно, т.к. не был уверен, что все окажутся такими шедевральными[/spoiler] я был готов наслаждаться игрой.
+шикарный саунтрек как и в других играх студии
+музыкальная мини игра (играл пока только пол часа, думаю она встретится не один раз)
+отличная мрачная атмосфера
+быстрый и динамичный геймплей
+присутствует кооп, как локальный, так и сетевой
+-РПГ элементы типа разного шмота влияющего на сопротивляемост/урон по разным типам врагов, оружие и его прокачна, прокачка здоровья. Лично для меня это плюс.
+-Отсутствие локализации (Для меня это не проблема, но все же в чарли мердер была локализация).

Эта игра, как и другие произведения студии заслуживают вашего внимания и стоит даже больше чем за нее просят, это конечно не "10/10играгода", но твердая 9, вы точно не пожалете о покупке (тем более при покупке комплекта из 3 игр вы сэкономите кучу денег)

33364087.review:
SO! First question you guys might ask yourselves when looking at this game:
Q: "Is the gameplay any good?"
A: Yes. BIG yes. So far, gameplay wise, it's the best side scrolling beat'em up I've ever played. The gameplay is fast paced, smooth, and VERY satisfying. Both with controller AND keyboard.
-
NOTE: For the keyboard though, you're gonna want to go into your options, and switch your, "Blood Warp" ability to the, "F" key. You'll know what I mean once you get the Blood Warp ability. (You get it within the 1st 5-10 minutes of playing)
=========
Now, as for the art style; it's incredible. (Like how I used that semicolon? Yah, I'm a smart boy.) Very stylized and well drawn. I really don't know what else to say about it besides I love it.
=========
THE STORY! I like it. It's got a main character you can get behind and root for, villains you can hate, and some cute moments sprinkled around here and there. ("I'm gonna call you Paka, cat~. Coming with me?" -Yuki)
=========
Wifu potential?: Aahhh, we're at this part of the review.
Dishwasher: Would be good husbandu. Glowing personality, good sense of humor, takes initiative, and is a dishwasher-vampire-ninja/samurai, so that's cool.
-
Yuki: Precious cinnamon bun who wants reveng, and to cuddle with her kitty. Simple girl with simple wants. 2 kyoot 4 tis' wurld. But yo, real talk tho, (I kinda hope my IRL friends don't see this but...) her battle grunts are actually super cute... "HUAAAH!!!" "OOOUUU!!!" Cute. Also she has a chainsaw for one of her arms, that's pretty neat.
=========
PRICE: Game is only ten bucks, $10.00. It's so worth it.
=========
How would I rate this game overall?: 69/69 (Aaaaawww, yeeeeah.)
But yo tho, this game is actually amazing.

Though can't say its same for online mode.  Had the same issue when i played the online 360 version, and the online problem still occurs in the PC version.  Due to just the fact i play online coop with a friend who's several cities away from me to hang out.

Couple hour into game with a friend, we'll end up trouble with one particular boss: "The Lich" where after certain damage he takes, he would teleport away for us to kill his shadow minions on different level, but after that then nothing happened as we were boxed into this level the boss created, and only assume we were to return back to continue damaging the boss, but we never were able to.  Thus we had to restart the entire level several times.  When we did beat him finally and proceed, only to met with several disconnection several levels later.

32636754.review:
Qui est-tu vraiment petite guerrière enragée ? Comment une créature fragile peut-elle prendre du plaisir à lacérer et manger de l'humain ?

En tout cas vous vous retrouvez dans une prison très spéciale car outre-terre ; les malades sanguinaires de votre sorte sont enfermés loin de tout et dame Sélène sera votre seule amie.

Un quartier barricadé, des gardes, et une surveillance extrême tenteront de vous contenir...les premières secondes.
Les gars de la station croyaient effectivement pouvoir me retenir dans cette cellule, avec de piètres liens, mais la rage écumait en moi et je voulais des réponses, donc je me suis régalée de carcasses et de têtes virevoltantes...

Mais un truc cloche, il y a un parfum de possession malsaine, même de magie obscure filtrant entre ces murs...Diablerie ? Sorcellerie ?

Tout ira mieux quand ces diantres visions assez réelles malgré tout cesseront, car j'ai l'impression d'avoir été droguée à l'ingré de mon pleinsu. Tout ces gens sont-ils réels ou sont-ils résidus de LSD ?

Mais c'est du délire total, j'arrive à m'échapper en allant trucider mon gardien-administrateur et ce dernier me blesse avant de mourir, pour me retrouver téléportée dans l'asile de fous de Outlast. (Référence à Diablo de x-men ??)

Et voilà que je suis en chaise roulante ??? Quoi ??? Comment ???

Le stress s'emparera de vous, l'adrénaline et la sorcellerie également, vous suinterez le sang et la chair putride ; *Miam* une bonne tranche de nuque, oh la belle bleue, oh la belle tête, oh la belle tronçonneuse...
Qui pourrait bien m'empêcher de bricoler mon corps et de devenir l'arme ultime ?
 
Et puis après tout, n'est-ce-pas uniquement une simple songerie temporaire qui me ramènera dans mon petit lit ??? 
On le verra bien dès que j'aurai exterminé mes bourreaux, en chaise branlante ou pas.

Une tuerie sanguinaire, du Salt and sanctuary sous acide, un gameplay parfait, du fun à l'infini, hail blood ! SKA STUDIO ->  Ultime inspiration.

Short Verison: Yes, Yes, Yes. It's deep fun, gorey hack 'n' slasher, with a style that Ska studio fine crafted themselves with a good OST

Detailed Verison: I first played the Dishwasher series on Xbox Live Arcade, the style was something that I haven't seen when I was younger, playing Dead Samurai was and still to this date great and I hope Ska studio brings that to Steam as well one day. With Vampire Smile, you can play as The Dishwasher as well but you can play as a new character called Yuki. 32033441.review:
很高兴终于能在STEAM上玩到这款久违的游戏了!这游戏在很大程度上相似于它的前作《洗碗工：死亡武士》。应该说就是换了个主人公，延续上一部的风格和操作。游戏本身的剧情就显得并不是很重要了。
本游戏是暗黑、横版的游戏风格，游戏模式是不停地用你的武器连招砍杀敌人，这个游戏说到底就是拿着武器拼命地怼敌人，夸张的战斗和流畅的连击是这游戏的一大亮点，刀刀见血击杀敌人的爽快感无与伦比。通过击败敌人收集到的钱可以在商店买道具或者升级。在游戏中有了五个新的武器,其中我个人比较喜欢的是一个大注射器和一个超大号的剪刀断头台，确实很符合我这种重口味啊！
游戏分为5种难度，我选择了中等的难度，还是可以勉强玩下去，如果真手残党或者新手玩家还是建议选择最简单的难度通关，还能有完整的剧情体验。此外，游戏还能本地或者联机进行多人合作，可以通过合作来实现更畅快的战斗！在战斗中你甚至还能玩吉他（什么龟？）和一些解谜元素在里面，算是小游戏了。如果想要流畅体验这种横版游戏，我建议是最好用手柄去玩，毕竟游戏是从xbox上移植过来的嘛。
玩后我才知道这游戏就是《盐和避难所》的制作组制作的，果然有异曲同工之妙啊，但难度没有《盐》那么大。
最后，我只想再补充一句，这么老的游戏到STEAM上了竟然还没有中文版，给个机翻也行啊，无力吐槽！

31986263.review:
軽快なアクションと歯ごたえのある難易度が特徴の2Dアクションです。
優しい難易度も用意されてますが、ゲームスピードは早いままなので慣れるまで大変かも。

独特の絵柄ですが、ド派手なエフェクトと血みどろな演出が実に楽しい。
ギターをメインとしたBGMで、あまり暗い雰囲気はありません。ホラー演出もあるにはありますが…血が出ればヤれるとばかりにそんなもん切って殴って打ち破ります。

主人公の回避行動が右スティックで行えるのが大きな特徴で、上下左右斜めと8方向に自在に移動できます。ヤバいと思ったらとにかく回避連打で離れたり空中に逃れるのが最初のコツ。連打も効くのでどんどん使いましょう。
敵の背後をとったり、ふっ飛ばした敵をこれで追いかけるのもグッド。直感的な操作でスタイリッシュに戦うことができます。…舌舐りしちゃいました？慣れていくと主人公の強さがプレイヤーの手で跳ね上がるシステムになっています。

また、敵や宝箱からお金が手に入り、要所でお買い物して成長要素に頼ることも可能。
進めるのがキツいと思ったらクリア済みのエリアで修行するといいでしょう。


オマケとして…音ゲー的なミニゲームと、マルチプレイが存在します。
音ゲーはABYXボタンを使うシンプルなもの。マルチプレイは2人で協力して攻略していくものです。

ちょっとマルチは体験しましたが、まさか独自ストーリーが存在するとは…
YUKIとお兄ちゃんの微笑ましい（血みどろ）道中を楽しむといいでしょう。人が居ればですが、クイックマッチでさっくり会えます。フレンドと一緒にやれる人はより楽しめるかもしれません。

イギリスの方と遊びましたがわりと快適でした。レッツトライ！

31922244.review: Outstanding game for anyone who loves brawler-types gameplay. I played the hell out of Salt&Sanctuary (same devs) and noticed/enjoyed a lot of the same elements and themes.  A lot of the soundeffects are totally identical to S&S but they're damn good soundeffects so I didn't mind. The combo system was gory and fun. The weapons were creative and with a little bit of effort I found them easy to master. The dodging system (or warping as I call it) was a little confusing at first, mainly because I found it hard to believe that dodging could be so OP (you basically can warp in any direction with 0 cooldown, essentially granting you unlimited invulnerable flight).  However, this mechanic fits the game's playstyle and doesn't negate the difficulty at all. Pretty dope. The only negative thing I have to say is that while the story was excellent and visceral, it simply wasn't long enough.  Today is my second day owing the game and I've already completed the game with both characters. No, I didn't spend all day on it either, overall I spent about 3 1/2 hours on each playthrough and I'm not a speedrunner. Granted, I haven't spent much time on arcade mode or gone back through to make sure I found all beads, upgrades, guitar solos, etc. So aside from a short story mode, I thoroughly enjoyed this game and highly recommend it to anyone who enjoys gory brawler games or who has played S&S.

31888037.review:
没有忍住原价入的，但感觉还是物超所值

作为和盐和避难所同公司出品的游戏，打击感和画风还有爆炸的血液没的说，突出一个赞。此外，不像银河恶魔城的盐和避难所，洗碗工里面省略很多找路跳跃和复活的困难，路线简单，人物无限冲刺，复活点也是一个房间一个，可以让人把重点放到砍砍砍上面，一气呵成，身心愉悦，内心舒畅。

难度方面整体不是很难，特别是存档点的设定让重新尝试变得很ez，暴力打一段时间总归可以通过。整体流程略短，单人物大约7-8个小时即可通关。怪物和boss的种类也略微匮乏，导致后期基本上就是之前见到的怪物和boss轮番上阵，新鲜感和紧张感稍有欠缺。但还有另一个角色、许多武器、更高的难度和挑战，耐玩度还是可以接受的。

总体来说，砍砍砍抓抓抓炸炸炸爽，手柄一阵抽搐，一切索然无味。

Вот и дождались. 4 года ожидания, и вот она. Лучшая игра в жанре 2D слешера.
Данная игра вышла ещё 2011 году на XBOX 360. Конечно же в то время я в неё не играл. Поиграл я в данный шедевр только в 2013, когда один парень сделал не официальный порт на PC. И черт побери, она работала, но это был всего лишь порт, то есть - не работали сохранения, не было мультиплеера, не было каких либо настроек. После этого разработчики "погрозили" парню пальчиком и сказали что сами портируют игру на PC. Время шло, игру всё не портировали, все стали про неё забывать. И вдруг, неожиданно, выходит ещё одна шедевральная игра от этой студии - Salt and Sanctuary, в которой чувствовались нотки той самой игры, The Dishwasher: Vampire Smile. Теперь же, вышла и она. Счастью нет предела. 
Для игры данного жанра, все сделано на уровне... и прошибает даже "потолок". Это ураганный, кровавый, мясной Слешер(именно с большой буквы) с неповторимой стилистикой и атмосферой прогинившего до мозга и костей мира, мира боли и отчаяние. И ВЫ в этом мире - СМЕРТЬ.
Крайне рекомендую к покупке, тем более за каких то жалких 249 руб. Игра того стоит!
Так же рекомендую к покупке Salt and Sanctuary. Игра является шикароной метроидванией с механиками Souls игры, типа Dark Souls 1-3 и Bloodborne, ну и Demon’s Souls естественно.

打起来还是和以前一样爽！！！手感简直太美。

记忆中死亡武士的画面和血腥度好像更牛X，打起来难度特别大，反正我打了三两关，就被一群杂兵虐的过不去了，接连被打断，从地上爬都爬不起来……只好放弃。
因为这游戏对连招和兵种相克的判定，还是很严格的。理不清楚关系就没法在快节奏的格斗中生存。
然后第二代连打开游戏的勇气都没有了。

既然STEAM上只有吸血鬼微笑这一代，就硬着头皮先爽一下吧，结果感觉这一代难度降低了？反正打了打，没怎么被敌人打断过，玩耍地很愉快！
处决技的时候随着节奏的猛烈，画面整体虚化效果也很重，这样虽然打击感十足，可是血腥度就不是那么养眼了啊。
手柄的支持也有BUG，如果你打着打着中途离开半分钟（比如我肾上腺素指数直线上升了口干舌燥，去解个手），回来再拿起手柄，怎么样狂乱操作都没有反应了。虽然手柄指示灯一直在亮，但就是任何反应都没有了。必须拔下来手柄，重新插一下才能正常。

最后，仍然希望初代能够上架，不然，再怎么情怀也感觉这游戏是不完整的。

31792537.review:
Objective important fact based review
It has:
Co op story
Single player story
Co op arcade mode
Singleplayer arcade mode.


2 player co op only.
Story is story and arcade is challenges with no narrative context. The arcade challenges have special conditions like "blitz" where you have a time limit and can extend it with kills. There are a lot of arcade missions.
You need to unlock them in a liniar order. Simgleplayer and co op arcade save progress seperately. But they are the same missions in the same order. 

And loading times are extremely short. They don't even feel like loading times. 

You can play with random people, but there isn't any indication that you are searching for another player. You are. Players you meet wont show in recent players on steam. 

Bringing up the steam overley pauses the game even in co op. 


It's satisfying to push yourself and become better and better. Tension builds as you lose health. You need to dodge a lot. Makes you feel like a powerful bad ass. The visuals and gour make kills brutal so your hits feel powerful.

31781228.review:
One of the best 2D action games I've ever played, and one of the best 360 games period.  The previous title secured Xbox's Summer of Arcade as a staple of the console's lifespan, and this one is everything that was but bigger, better and bloodier.  Plus a chainsaw arm.

If the developer didn't go their own different way with their take on the 2D Beat-em up with Charlie Murder and the equally acclaimed Salt & Sanctuary, I would have been perfectly fine if this became one of the faces of Xbox.  While that's clearly not the route they took, to have it now up on Steam for all is certainly a treat, especially to newcomers.  The only part lacking is the, well, lack of the original title.  Still, I highly recommend this to those new to the series and looking for a challenge and some fun.

- но вот аркада! АРКАДА - ЭТО САТАНА! если по началу все еще более-менее проходимо. с матюками, нервами, но проходимо. то потом: вам дают водяной пистолетик, узкую комнату и по семь мобов в рандомном порядке, причем может сложиться так, что останется три ниндзи-инвизника, что означает, что ваш пердак улетит на неизмеримое расстояние!
- последние два испытания и вовсе маразматические: убить и так не в меру хардовых боссов, при этом размотать еще дюжину пиздюков. если с драконом можно еще использовать хитрость: летать по верху карты и расстреливать его, ибо это единственное место с намеком на безопасность. однако подобные подходы неприемлемы для таких игр, ну ладно, хуй с ним, хотя бы пройдем. то последнее - это просто цирк. сначала развалите две кучи мобов, потом развалите кучу мобов и босса. естественно, вы, как человек адекватный, начнете сначала харасить мелочь, ибо они просто мешают добраться до босса. и мне абсолютно поебсти, что можно найти на ютубе видюхи, как кто-то проходит это испытание не потеряв ни одного хп или на самом высшем ранге! знайте, что эти люди явно продали свою душу, чтобы задрочиться в эту херню! рядовому геймеру с приличным опытом это на 99% не под силу! я люблю хардкор, но это - это просто маразм!

31771694.review:
Por ahora no quiero hacer un análisis completo del juego, pero quiero que mi voto positivo quede hasta que pueda realizar una crítica coherente del título. Por ahora me dejare llevar por lo que he jugado, que no es poco.
Este título salió en Xbox Live en 2011. Lo jugué y realmente me encantó, hasta el punto de que por alguna extraña razón, dejo una marca en mis recuerdos. Me quedó una espinita al no poder acabarlo en su momento. Cuando me enteré de que salía para PC me dio una gran alegría. Uno de los títulos que más deseba de este año. De hecho, ahora que lo compré por una cantidad muy a tener en cuenta (10€), al ponerme a los mandos, no solo me ha satisfecho, sino que, además, ha superado todas mis expectativas y aquellos recuerdos; sorprendiendome con un estilo de combate muy poderoso y basado puramente en la habilidad, claramente influenciado por titulos como Devil May Cry, God of War... Haciendo gala de una velocidad endiablada y tremendamente bien ejecutada imposible de conseguir si no fuera por un diseño inteligente de mecanicas de juego, de enemigos y jefes. Todo mezclado, funciona a las mil maravillas y que alucinará a los seguidores de los Hack and Slash. Eso si, aviso, el juego se desarrolla en entornos completamente en 2D sin profundidad. Algo que para algunos les puede tirar para atrás.
*A mi me parece que beneficia su estilo de combate y permite dotarle de una mayor sensacion de velocidad y una mayor profundidad a nivel mecánico. Recomendadísimo. Una pequeña joya imperfecta que por meritos propios se merece estar entre mis juegos favoritos de todos los tiempos. Cuando haya jugado más y lo complete al 100% espero realizar una crítica mejor fundamentada de sus pros y sus contras, que ya voy adelantando, son pocos. Será que la nostalgia está hablando por mi.

31765005.review:
Безумная игра. Классная музыка, классная рисовка, классные боссы. Динамичная и агрессивная боёвка, отличное управление.  2D-слэшер, каким он должен быть.

Единственная просьба к Ska Studios. Ребят, 21 век на дворе. Не обязательно каждый раз перед боссом показывать кат-сценки. Особенно в динамичной игре, где не терпится поскорее разобраться с боссом. Кат-сценки короткие, но это всё равно сбивает ритм и раздражает, если застрял на боссе. Для сравнения в Dark Souls и Bloodborne кат-сценки могут быть  длинными, но смотрим их только один раз. В итоге мысли не распыляются и думаешь только о боссе.

P.S. Советую обратить внимание на игру Salt & Sanctuary от этих разработчиков. Игра выполнена в жанре метроидвания с заметным виянием Dark Souls. Большой мир, много запоминающихся боссов, разнообразная боёвка и возможность сделать билд по своему вкусу (dex, str и т.п.).

31756834.review:
Simply one of the best Indie-games back then and even nowadays! 
Love Ska Studio's art style and dark atmosphere. 
The game is a fast paced hack and slay 2D side scroller with lots of gore. 

For a little Indie-game this game has a surprising amount of combos that are only matched by Bayonetta and Ninja Gaiden. 

There is one negative aspect that bothered me since the original release on the 360:

Ska Studio games tend to have some sorts of exploits that make the games very easy in some ways. 

In Salt and Sanctuary you have the super jump so you could reach areas without finding the air dash rune first. 

In the original Dishwasher all you had to do was to level up the meat cleavers and spam the triple "strong" attack to defeat everything that wasn't able to fly. 

In Vampire Smile you can do the same or simply teleport around until the soldiers start to hang down from their ropes, teleport to them and slice or throw them to pieces. 

I beat the hardest difficulty simply by throwing everything i could find around.

But it is still one of my fav. game series especially because of the art, the music, the atmosphere and the fast paced action. 

Now all we need is Dishwasher Dead Samurai on Pc and maybe a third game?

31740661.review:
Ну что ж... Полагаю, вернее было бы обозреть после прохождения, освоения и достаточного понимания. Хотя по фиг.

Итак, с этой игрой, как и с её первой частью, я познакомился году в тринадцатом или даже двенадцатом. К сожалению, только со стороны по отсутствию "Бокса" и толкового эмулятора на тот момент. Наконец, вторая часть, "Vampire smile", вышла для ПеКарен. (Хотя я был бы больше рад первой, "Dead samurai").

Сюжет тут, в общем-то, не так важен. Вникать не обязательно. Если коротко, история безымянного Посудомойщика и его сводной сестры Юки (оба вампиры, насколько я понимаю) о том, как они сражаются с киборгами во имя всего доброго и кошерного.

Геймплейно игра отличается скоростью и относительной трудностью. Тут имеется в качестве основной части слэшер, включающий в себя, как и положено, различные комбо, и элементы платформера. Ну и щепотка музыкальной аркады, где следует нажимать на верную кнопку в верное время, чтобы сыграть ноту.

Визуальное оформление–фирменный стиль "Ska studios". Мрачное, жуткое, кровавое и безумное 2D. По рисовке напоминает комикс. Да. Оживший комикс, в котором всё, что движется, брызжет кровью и разбрасывается мясом при контакте с чем-нибудь из вооружения.

Кстати о вооружении, есть тут довольно большой арсенал. Относительно большой, разумеется. Вот то, что уже открыто в моём случае: катана, парные тесаки, огромные ножницы, огромная булава, обмотанная колючей проволокой и всякими лезвиями, водяной пистолет и работающий тостер (угадайте, зачем), пистолет-пулемёт, дробовик, несколько магических приёмов, творящих гуро. И это, видимо, только половина.

Есть также особые предметы–бусы. Бусы при экипировке дают определённый эффект. Например, есть бусы, увеличивающие урон электричеством, есть бусы, выбивающие больше золота из врагов, есть бусы, от которых в бою восстанавливается здоровье, а есть и такие, которые добавляют трёхмерный эффект для игры в очках.

Пасхалки тоже имеются. Так, в одной из секретных комнат вы найдёте постер на тему "Чарли Мёрдера", а посреди смачного замеса уже в другой комнате будет справа внизу выскакивать кошак (как Toasty в "Мортал комбате"), что добавит происходящему ещё немного безумия.

Да, эта игра безумна, трудна и жестока. Моя оценка по десятибалльной шкале–8/10. До моего идеала вряд ли дотянет, но всё равно годнота. Таки рекомендую.

31734731.review:
Fast, brutal, and stylish. That's what Dishwasher is. A side-scrolling stylish action game where your dodge is basically Nightcrawler's teleport. You constantly warp and roll around, slicing at enemies, tangling with their blocks, bleeding them out, and then ripping them apart with an execution when they're ready to die. Weapon switch cancelling, dodge cancelling, slow-downs on powerful hits, all the good stuff is there. (FYI: Weapon switch cancelling is the most important part.)

The slow weapons hit like beasts, the fast weapons still feel good too.

For a game made by just two people, it's really good. The combat mechanics are dead on (Though I would take issue with a couple of enemy attack hitboxes), the aesthetic is heavy metal complete with electric guitar/violin solos as rhythm minigames. The story plays into this well, managing to be edgy enough for heavy metal but not enough to cause cringe*. Two characters, 9 weapons plus guns... This is simply an excellent port of an excellent game.

There is not much to the game beyond the combat. The levels tend to have several paths to hide items/equippables but they don't waste your time. Four difficulties and a timed speed-run mode with leaderboards. Then a challenge mode with well over 50 combat challenges of varying configurations, and then a survival mode. Dishwasher knows what it is good at and gives you a lot of ways to enjoy it. If you are at all interested in side-scrolling stylish combat action or curious to see what the devs of Salt and Sanctuary did before that game, take a plunge.

*As an aside, this storytelling skill is what S&S vets might expect. In Salt and Sanctuary the same devs wrote a Dark Souls style story better than the Dark Souls devs ever did.

31724549.review:
This is a must-have for any fan of skill-based, twitch, 2D action.  The sword fighting is the most satisfying of any 2D game out there.

The first thing you will be struck by is the impressive styel.  The art, music, and overall presentation make it look like a dark indie comic brought to life.  From there, the combat sucks you in.  There are a variety of weapons and combos that make you feel like you could take on an entire army.

In combat, you are given two hand held weapons at a time and able quickly switch during combat allowing you to come up with custom combos.  You also have a machine gun, chainsaw, and sometimes a shotgun to spice things up even further.

Fatalities are the cherry on top.  The brutality of smashing heads against the wall until they explode makes combat that much more satisfying.

The story mode is great, but the main attraction are the Arcade and Challenge modes that let you drop in and out for quick combat.

31717688.review:
I haven't put enough hours in the game yet, but you know what? This game deserves some words regardless. In one hour I am confident enough to recommend it cause it's.. DAMN.. GOOD!

One thing first though. Do not expect a lot of depth per weapon. It's fairly basic hack'n'slash spam one to two buttons, no huge Devil May Cry-like combos. Does that make it bad? Heck no! Just a fair warning to not have unreasonable expectations.

Okay? Okay...

Look at that price! 10 dollars. What would you expect out of 10 dollars? Bugger all probably, that's the kind of price "walking-simulators" tend to go for. But no, no no no no nooo. What you get is bloody gore-fest that even has local co-op. Yeah you read that right, LOCAL.. CO-OP! Multiplayer too.

Speaking of bloody gore, there's ton of it, and all very well animated for the artstyle chosen. You feel the strength of your actions and get to enjoy the murderous rampage you are in throughout the whole experience. Said experience being a Metrovania game at heart but with a level selection.

Though it doesn't only let you select levels, it lets you select character even! In fact, depending on the character you pick or depending whether you play co-op or not you get to see different cutscenes. The cutscenes are kinda like a very short comic, following the general artstyle of the game, which is not bad, though personally I didn't really like it that much. They don't look as crispy as the rest of the game, fairly pixelated. But whatever, they don't last too long.

Having that said, the story isn't really that engaging so those low-quality cutscenes are kinda the icing on the cake. Minor spoilers, it's a [spoiler] revenge story where your character starts from the bottom of the situation, gets powerful, goes after revenge. [/spoiler] However, there's enough hints around to keep it a tiny bit spicy, making you wonder what happened and wanting to get those few answers. Will they come? No idea, but even if they do not there's still some satisfying combat to be had!

What can I say about combat? It's amazingly satisfying. There, done! Okay fine... 

There's a complete lack of blocking, only dodging, so it's all about keeping up a fast pace and picking your enemies out fast enough to not die, and at higher difficulties you WILL die. The game tends to drop a lot of enemies at you and the AI is not dumb. If they could they would be killing you actively but there's some limitations to them thankfully. On the other hand, at lower difficulties the game should be fairly "relaxing", as relaxing as a massacre of screaming humanoids could be, though I imagine a few accidental deaths can happen there too. The bosses get tricky very fast. In usual Metrovania style you get multiple weapons and magic that you can swap around on the fly and sometimes use to unlock new passages even, which is where a big part of the fun comes from, mastering the swaping and usage of all your arsenal.

Though nothing is perfect, and the kinda annoying issue that the game has is that you cannot cancel animations into dodge, so no matter how fast you are you could get hit because you were mid combo. Luckily, there's some ways around it but it's possible you will feel a bit cheated sometimes. Just don't spam that attack button will you?

Well, that's about it really. Most importantly it's SO freaking worth it for 10 dollars, be it alone or with a friend. Do you think you'd like it from what the videos and screenshots show? If so, give it a try!

31714147.review:
Video format for those who prefer it (otherwise keep scrolling for the written version):
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bEhtYGXV5kw

The Dishwasher: Vampire Smile and Charlie Murder were both released on PC on the same day and they're made by the same developer. So I thought I would write something up on the PC ports of both version. You can find my Charlie Murder version linked at the end.

Getting into the gameplay breifly, Vampire Smile is an incredibly unique character action 2D Hack'N'Slash game. It's one of those games with a very recognizable artistic style. It's got this dirty yet pleasing look to it. Many games try doing this dark and gritty look but it's always too high fidelity and often comes off too polished than what it should be.
Smile feels like it is rooted properly in a visual style that bleeds uneasiness. Gameplay is also very interesting. It's a character action game with a combo system including aerial attacks and multiple weapon styles but it's also set as a side scroller. It's a really fun, action-packed title with a story to tell that blends well with the dark art style.

Onto the port!
Vampire Smile and Charlie Murder are very identical in terms of the PC port so what I say here is comparable to Charlie Murder. Vampire has a ton of resolution options, some of which go beyond 1080p. The game also supports borderless windowed mode, fullscreen and windowed mode in addition to having seperate volume sliders for sound effects and music. The game was original an Xbox 360 Arcade title when it was released back in the summer of 2013 so it's not really a graphical powerhouse. The dirty, muddy art style actually holds up really nicely as it doesn't bring down the fact that this was once an Xbox 360 title. As a result there aren't any graphics options. This will run on almost anything.

You also have options to rebind your keyboard and mouse controls. However, some of the defaults aren't exactly ideal. For starters, the in-game menu is bound to Escape, the settings menu is bound to Enter and the default attack is bound to the U key. Once again you do have the option to rebind all of them and having the mouse and keyboard use the same actions is pretty cool but it is finicky when first booting it up.

There is also an issue if you want to record gameplay with Radeon Relive (AMD's Capture Software). The game refused to be recorded if you start in fullscreen mode and if you change back to fullscreen accidently the software will bug out and break. The multiplayer also doesn't have any kind of lobby/server system to find games.

Overall it's a great port. If you're looking for more of a brawler and don't mind needing to use a gamepad for the most part, Charlie Murder is more up your alley. However, for 9.99 The Dishwasher: Vampire Smile is a really good, unique game that a lot of people will enjoy once they give it a chance. The 2-player co-op is also a nice touch for couch gaming.

You can check out more info on Charlie Murder here (written): http://steamcommunity.com/id/76561198009283722/recommended/405290
Or you can check out the video linked above at 6:18 where I talk about it:

Thanks for reading.

31708133.review:
I've played both the first game Dead Samurai and Vampire Smile on my xbox360. Yes you should get the game. 

If you want 2D Ninja Gaiden Black or Devil May Cry on crack, you got it. People say its hard and believe them it is at first. Its hard because you can't block and the enemies deal so much of damage. But you can warp all around the stage all you want. Yes you can go wreckless but you shouldn't go for broke all the time. 

It feels more fluid than Dead Samurai because once you get the arsenal you can just shoot at anytime while using your melee weapons. The finishing moves are nice with the floor/wall bashing and the izuna drop. The combo system is very intuitive.

You get to play as two characters, Dishwasher or Yuki. Playing as the Dishwasher was more fun than playing as Yuki but thats my opinion. Yuki is faster and optimal but the Dishwasher is more crazier. The Dishwasher has much more fun and dynamic weapons. Remember when your mother told you not to run around with scissors? Well now is your chance. Just mash up Y X Y X Y X and you are cutting everything in your way. The Dekkentozter is a very unorthodox weapon but it is a very strong weapon. Its because you have to squirt water (which does no damage) and then hit your enemy with the electric thingy (which does SUPER damage). 

I have not yet tried out coop mode because the 360 build was a bit fuzzy. I hope the steam netcode is much better when I try it. Hit me up if you guys want to play.

31707853.review:
This release came as such a total surprise to me, actually finding out about it two days before it hit Steam - I was doing a Dishwasher cosplay/build through Salt & Sactuary, Ska Studios' latest and most ambitious title. 

I first played this when it came out on the Xbox Arcade many moons ago, and have been dreaming of the day I could play it again, especially on PC after the Xbox kicked the bucket. I feel in love with the original The Dishwasher: Dead Samurai, and this game is one of those extrememly rare examples of stellar sequels that somehow manage to keep all that made the original great while adding to it. Paint the grimy, bleak and dreary environments in red cyborg guts with a wide variety of weapons, all the while feeling like an absolute badass as you weave between waves of creative enemies. There's a bit of exploration, rewarded by finding helpful hidden items, or keys to progress, and loads of great bossfights interspersed throughout. 

The real gem / takeaway from the game is something hard to describe without playing it - it's the "feel" of it. Dark and brooding atmosphere, bottomless buckets of gore, and a stellar soundtrack all combine to make a unique game out of a plain genre. I don't even really like hack-n'-slash games.

The music adds a lot - so much so that I've been trying in vain for a while now to get Pain Administrator or The Sunken March to play in Salt & Sanctuary when a boss shows up. I had the chance to see Ska Studios a while ago during PAX when they were promoting Charlie Murder, and when I was done sperglording out I had asked about how the music is done. I'm still struggling over how James nonchalantly said "Garage Band" - that's insane.  

Fantastic game from fantastic people! Combat is super-smooth and crisp, finishers gruesome and satisfying. If you're into hack-n'-slash / beat em' ups, this game is pure unadulterated joy. One of my favorite aspects of Vampire Smile (and all Ska Games) is that it's so uniquely their own game. Its everything that makes passionate indie titles so great - I could never play anything like this from anybody else; when just two (!) people create a game, everything in it is from them alone. Everything that makes the game up becomes almost personal in that way, like a vision from them to you.

Fantastic / 10 would ride the Dragon hellivator in an endless loop of retries again.
